channel.title: Connection Refused with Demonik. Help please
channel.description:
I've got the ports forwarded, both 80 and the other, and yet I'm still getting connection errors.
I've changed the configuration file for the devine 5.0 client to point to my servers IP address. It still is giving me the same error.
Java.net.connectionexception: conection refused: connect.
If you want pictures to prove the fact that my ports are all forwarded, I'll be glad to oblige. Just please don't flame.
ANYWAY, any help would be appreciated. I would like to say I'm using a Netgear router and it's sometimes iffy on forwarding, so if you think that's the problem, please don't be shy to inform me.
More info: I'm running Windows Server 2003 with the 43595 ports and 80 ports all open through the fire wall, and on the router the same ports are open through the hardware firewall.
Edit: Could it be a problem with the Server.bat? I just ran it, caught a prtsc before it closed (that was fun), and found this error:
ANT_HOME is set incorrectly or ant could not be located. Please set ANT_HOME.
When configuring the bat file, do I just add set ANT_HOME=C:\Apacheant\bin? Or, do I replace ant demonikp2p? I read a tutorial about it that helped somewhat, but never gave very direct specifics...

item.title: Connection Refused with Demonik. Help please
item.dc:creator: @angels0fdeath01 angels0fdeath01
item.description:
@angels0fdeath01 wrote:

Problem Solved Moderators Please Lock. Thank You

Read full topic
item.source: Connection Refused with Demonik. Help please

item.title: Connection Refused with Demonik. Help please
item.dc:creator: @deadheart deadheart
item.description:
@deadheart wrote:

Well, I’ve come to two conclusions: Either A) I’m mentally retarded and I’m so incompatent that I can’t forward a port, or B) The client problem is router-end and the router, which I’ve known mine to do, is refusing to forward ports because it’s a terrible, idiotic machine. Which one do you think? Like I said, it clearly says in my router that I’ve got the port fowarded. It’s an older router, from around 2005.

Read full topic

item.source: Connection Refused with Demonik. Help please

item.title: Connection Refused with Demonik. Help please
item.dc:creator: @angels0fdeath01 angels0fdeath01
item.description:
@angels0fdeath01 wrote:

What kind of router are you using?

Did you port forward 43594

Make sure your using your internal ip address when portforwarding this is the 192.168.1.xxx numbers

Also when editing your client folder you have to make sure the settings.ini points to your external ip address.

To find your external ip use www.ipchicken.com

Read full topic
item.source: Connection Refused with Demonik. Help please

item.title: Connection Refused with Demonik. Help please
item.dc:creator: @deadheart deadheart
item.description:
@deadheart wrote:

Thank you! You got the server to work! Now time to test the Client… So far so good, a little laggy like Java always starts as on Windows 7… But still getting Connection Refused. My firewall automatically made a rule to allow Java on that port so… That means it’s in either my ISP or Router, correct? My router has been known to not work worth shit when it comes to port forwarding…

Read full topic

item.title: Connection Refused with Demonik. Help please
item.dc:creator: @deadheart deadheart
item.description:
@deadheart wrote:

I figured part of it out lol. I apparently put the PATH and CLASSPATH in user variables, not system variables. But, run server is still giving the same “’“java.exe”’ is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.” error. At least, last time I took a screen capture that’s what it says. It doesn’t stay up long enough to read.

Read full topic

operable program or batch file.”

item.title: Connection Refused with Demonik. Help please
item.dc:creator: @deadheart deadheart
item.description:
@deadheart wrote:

Nope, now both are doing the lovely “Oh, lets open CMD then close it as soon as it opens so it’s impossible to read what the error is!”…

Edit:

My @echo off
set PATH=%PATH%;ant\bin
set JAVA_HOME=C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_21
ant

Seems to work in building, so now it’s just the server. Do you think, instead of using %PATH%; if I hard code the location that it might work?

Read full topic
item.source: Connection Refused with Demonik. Help please

item.title: Connection Refused with Demonik. Help please
item.dc:creator: @angels0fdeath01 angels0fdeath01
item.description:
@angels0fdeath01 wrote:

Change Compile.bat to this:

@echo off
title (Your Server Name Compiler)
set PATH=%PATH%;C:\apache-ant-1.7.1\bin
set JAVA_HOME=C:\Program Files\java\jdk1.6.0_21
ant -buildfile build.xml

Change your Server.bat to this:

@echo off
TITLE NOOBscape
set PATH=%PATH%;C:\apache-ant-1.7.1\bin
ant runserver

Try this and let me know how you make out?

Read full topic
item.source: Connection Refused with Demonik. Help please

item.title: Connection Refused with Demonik. Help please
item.dc:creator: @deadheart deadheart
item.description:
@deadheart wrote:

Mine is

@echo off
set PATH=%PATH%;ant\bin
set JAVA_HOME=C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_21
ant

Might be that I’m missing -buildfile build.xml… But the major amount of problems is coming from server.bat and client.bat.

My server bat is set up like this:

@echo off
TITLE EasyRSC
set PATH=%PATH%;ant\bin
ant runserver

Should it be ant -runserver? But that doesn’t explain the java.exe error I’m getting.

Edit: Also, this is only happening on Windows 7. On Windows Server 2003, it would run the server and build just fine, but it’d give me the “connection refused” error when attempting to use the client.

Read full topic
item.source: Connection Refused with Demonik. Help please

item.title: Connection Refused with Demonik. Help please
item.dc:creator: @angels0fdeath01 angels0fdeath01
item.description:
@angels0fdeath01 wrote:

What version of java are you using SDK or JDK?

Your build or compile.bat file should read something like this: Right click and edit to view!

@echo off
title (Server Name Compiler)
set PATH=%PATH%;C:\apache-ant-1.7.1\bin
set JAVA_HOME=C:\Program Files\java\jdk1.6.0_20
ant -buildfile build.xml

Now that is what mine looks like your will obviously have your ant version and your SDK or JDK version set the way it is set in your java folder!

If all this is set correctly you should have no problems.

Read full topic
item.source: Connection Refused with Demonik. Help please

item.title: Connection Refused with Demonik. Help please
item.dc:creator: @deadheart deadheart
item.description:
@deadheart wrote:

I’m trying that “easy” one, and it’s giving me even more problems. I decided to give up on the server server (for now), but now I’m getting this little error: Can not find “java.exe”. “Java.exe” is not a valid yada yada yada yada, bunch of mumbo jumbo that’s not entirely important because it gives no error code number. I set up the environmental variables for JSK (that’s what it’s called right? Not the runtime, but the other one lol), and yet I still get that error. I have it installed, 32-bit. My computer’s 64 bit but I don’t use a 64 bit browser so… Should I upgrade?

Edit: Apparently, idky, every time I try to “build” easyRSC, the build file ends up deleted (not the bat, the folder it creates). I’m running Windows 7, I have the permissions of the folder set to everyone can modify, it’s at my computers root, etc. etc. etc. and I’m running it in admin mode. Any ideas?

Edit 2: And I’m still getting a connection denied… I’ve also used sites to check to see if 46594/5 are open and both say they’re not even though on my router they’re said they are… sigh Apparently I’m not meant to have my own server…

Edit 3: Apparently the build is working, but the server isn’t, giving me the Java.exe isn’t a valid protocol or program (something of that sorts). Also, it’s when trying to run the client (just to see if I still get the error) that it says that access is denied to the port.

Read full topic
item.source: Connection Refused with Demonik. Help please

If your just starting out with private server try Easy rsc v3 thats what i used and it helped me greatly.

Try this one its modified by motaro.

http://uppit.com/7r76mhkes8xj/EasyRSC.rar

Read full topic

item.title: Connection Refused with Demonik. Help please

item.description:
@deadheart wrote:

At least someone gave information. What one that’s as close to RSC (without idioticly modded to hell files) you can get? Basically I want to be able to play RSC with just me and my friend. I’ve got a literal server set up to host it, I just need the sources etc. to host it with.

Read full topic

  2. Scrap demonik, it’s ancient and bugged to hell.
